channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Will Arsenal's end-of-season form haunt them again?
item.description: Arsenal are four points clear at the top of the Premier League with 12 games to play - but will recent history repeat itself?

item.title: Arsenal miss chance to restore six-point lead in Brentford draw
item.description: Arsenal miss out on the chance to restore their six-point lead at the top of the Premier League in a thrilling 1-1 draw at Brentford.

item.title: Are football fans booing their team more?
item.description: Booing at football is an accepted part of the game. It's been around since time began, but are fans increasingly booing their own team?

item.title: Sutton's FA Cup fourth-round predictions v Daffy Duck & Porky Pig
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Daffy Duck and Porky Pig - and AI - with his predictions for all 16 FA Cup fourth-round ties.

item.title: Tuchel extended England stay for 'amazing players'
item.description: Thomas Tuchel says he extended his contract as England manager through to Euro 2028 because of the "amazing group of players" at his disposal.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Sterling joins Feyenoord until end of season
item.description: Former Chelsea and Manchester City winger Raheem Sterling joins Dutch club Feyenoord on a deal until the end of the season.

item.title: Nottingham Forest close in on Pereira appointment
item.description: Nottingham Forest close to appointing former Wolves boss Vitor Pereira as their new head coach.

item.title: Bellamy aims high after Wales' Nations League draw
item.description: Wales are grouped with Portugal, Denmark and Norway in the Nations League.

item.title: To boo or not to boo? Pundits and fans have their say
item.description: Football fans and BBC pundits Danny Murphy, Joe Hart and Wayne Rooney have their say on whether it is OK to boo your own team.

item.title: Guehi and Glasner 'had big disagreement' during defeat by Macclesfield
item.description: Macclesfield assistant manager Francis Jeffers tells The Wayne Rooney Show Oliver Glasner and Marc Guehi had a "big disagreement" at half-time in Crystal Palace's FA Cup third-round defeat by the non-league side.

item.title: Hull will always have a special place in my heart - Rosenior
item.description: Chelsea manager Liam Rosenior sits down with BBC Sport before Friday night's FA Cup fourth-round clash with Hull City - a team he used to both play for and manage.

item.title: Andrews praises 'sensational' Brentford after Arsenal draw
item.description: Brentford manager Keith Andrews feels his side outperformed Arsenal in the second half of their 1-1 draw at the GTech Community Stadium in the Premier League.

item.title: Arsenal let game become chaotic - Arteta
item.description: Mikel Arteta says his side lacked discipline and composure in the second half, as Arsenal have to settle for a 1-1 draw away at Brentford in the Premier League.

item.title: Tottenham target Pulisic - Friday's gossip
item.description: Tottenham are showing interest in Christian Pulisic, Paris St-Germain are preparing a £100m bid for Brighton's Carlos Baleba, and Newcastle United will target a new striker in the summer.

item.title: Wrexham duo plot downfall of former club Ipswich
item.description: Nathan Broadhead and Kieffer Moore both helped Ipswich Town in their rise up the football pyramid but are now bidding to knock their former club out of the FA Cup with Wrexham.

item.title: Tottenham are 'not a big club' - Postecoglou
item.description: Former head coach Ange Postecoglou criticises Tottenham's transfer strategy in the wake of Thomas Frank's sacking.

item.title: Tuchel deal delights FA - but timing has echoes of Capello decision
item.description: The FA is celebrating England head coach Thomas Tuchel's new deal as a coup - but the timing revives memories of its Fabio Capello blunder, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: England to face Spain and Croatia in Nations League
item.description: England will face Spain, Croatia and the Czech Republic in the 2026-27 Uefa Nations League group stage, while Wales are drawn with holders Portugal.

item.title: NI relish 'competitive' Nations League draw - O'Neill
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill says "there are no easy games" in the Nations League after being drawn with Hungary, Ukraine and Georgia.

item.title: Injured Bellingham a doubt for England friendlies
item.description: Jude Bellingham is a doubt for England's March friendlies amid fears from Real Madrid his hamstring injury is worse than first thought.

item.title: Did Dyche deserve the sack at Nottingham Forest?
item.description: After Sean Dyche's reign lasts just 114 days, Nottingham Forest are on the hunt for a fourth head coach of the season - but was he hard done by?

item.title: Man Utd fans have say on Ratcliffe's immigration claims
item.description: The billionaire's comments about the UK being "colonised" by immigrants have divided opinion.

item.title: Ratcliffe sorry language 'offended some' after immigration comments
item.description: The Manchester United co-owner previously said the UK had been "colonised" by immigrants.

item.title: Ex-West Ham forward Antonio in talks with Charlton
item.description: Michail Antonio holds initial talks with Charlton Athletic about a possible return to domestic football after his near fatal car crash.

item.title: Republic of Ireland will fulfil Israel games - FAI
item.description: The Republic of Ireland will fulfil their Nations League fixtures with Israel, says the Football Association of Ireland (FAI).

item.title: Bompastor keeps reason for Green's Chelsea exit 'private'
item.description: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor says she wants Paul Green's exit as head of women's football after 13 years kept "private and confidential".

item.title: How 'terrific' Wirtz shone for Liverpool
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy says Florian Wirtz was "pulling the strings" for Liverpool in their 1-0 against Sunderland.

item.title: Should Foden have been sent off against Fulham?
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy believes Manchester City's Phil Foden was "lucky" not to have been sent off for a tackle on Fulham's Calvin Bassey.

item.title: Van Dijk scores as Liverpool beat Sunderland to close top-four gap
item.description: Virgil van Dijk's header gives Liverpool a 1-0 victory over Sunderland, as Arne Slot's side become the first away team to win at the Stadium of Light in the Premier League this season.

item.title: Haaland ends open-play goal drought as Man City beat Fulham
item.description: Erling Haaland scores his first goal from open play in the Premier League in nine games, as Manchester City soundly defeat Fulham 3-0 to move three points behind league leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Burnley score three quickfire goals to stun Palace in comeback win
item.description: Burnley score three goals in seven minutes as Scott Parker's side come from 2-0 down to beat Crystal Palace 3-2 at Selhurst Park in the Premier League.

item.title: Spurs' Odobert to have surgery after rupturing ACL
item.description: Tottenham winger Wilson Odobert will have surgery after rupturing the anterior cruciate ligament in his left knee, his club confirms.

item.title: Barnes rules out Scotland switch, confirms Clarke
item.description: Newcastle United winger Harvey Barnes will not be switching allegiance from England to Scotland before the World Cup, says head coach Steve Clarke.

item.title: Lucky break that changed Alexander-Arnold's Real future
item.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold endured a difficult start at Real Madrid but his prospects are looking up - and it might earn him a ticket to the World Cup.

item.title: Barnet boss gets nine-game ban for abusing female referee
item.description: Barnet manager Dean Brennan is given a nine-game touchline ban for verbally abusing referee Kirsty Dowle, with reference to gender.

item.title: 'I didn't hesitate' - Tuchel extends stay in England 'dream job'
item.description: Thomas Tuchel commits to two more years as England manager, which will take him through to Euro 2028.

item.title: Another plot twist in Scottish title race for the ages
item.description: BBC Scotland examines the lie of the land in the Scottish Premiership title race.

item.title: 'Big asset' Oxlade-Chamberlain has immediate Celtic impact
item.description: Martin O'Neill hails Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's impact after the former Arsenal and Liverpool midfielder nets a crucial winner on his Celtic debut.

item.title: Ex-Arsenal midfielder Partey facing two additional rape charges
item.description: The former Arsenal midfielder is set to appear in court on 13 March.

item.title: Dundee Utd face four matches in 14 days on weather-struck pitch
item.description: Dundee United face playing four matches in 14 days on their weather-beaten Tannadice Park pitch after a request for postponed games to be rearranged for later dates was turned down.

item.title: Will 40-point mark be needed for Premier League survival?
item.description: Will the 40-point mark - or thereabouts - be needed to guarantee survival this term, with an in-form West Ham attempting to chase down the sides above them?

item.title: Why the Nations League still matters to World Cup-bound Scotland
item.description: The Nations League does not carry the prestige of other competitions, but Thursday's draw still carries huge importance to Scotland and the Tartan Army.

item.title: Premier League quiz: Name every manager departure this season
item.description: There've been eight times this season a Premier League club has parted ways with a permanent head coach.

item.title: Frank's downfall: Inside his struggle to get players and fans onboard
item.description: Thomas Frank has been sacked as Tottenham manager after just eight months in charge. BBC Sport's Sami Mokbel takes a closer look at his tenure.

item.title: Why Frank at Tottenham was a gamble that ended in bitter failure
item.description: Thomas Frank's sacking came as no surprise on Wednesday. His appointment by Tottenham was a gamble that ended in a storm of toxicity, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Carrick's 'Sir Alex' playbook and a happy start at Man Utd
item.description: Michael Carrick is happy with his start as Manchester United head coach despite dropping his first points in 1-1 draw at West Ham.

item.title: Can you name the past 10 permanent Spurs managers?
item.description: Thomas Frank has been sacked by Tottenham after just under eight months in charge - can you name the managers who came before him?

item.title: Why are Aberdeen taking so long to appoint a manager?
item.description: The club are still working to find Jimmy Thelin's successor, a month after the Swede's exit.

item.title: Can you name the players with most Premier League appearances?
item.description: James Milner equals the record for most Premier League appearances.

item.title: All February's done deals, including deadline day, in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: How does the Nations League work and when is the draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the Uefa Nations League works ahead of the draw for the 2026-27 competition

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Scotland to meet Switzerland in Nations League
item.description: Scotland will face Switzerland, Slovenia and North Macedonia in Group B1 in the next edition of the Nations League.

item.title: Hamilton docked points for third time this season
item.description: Hamilton Academical are hit with a third points penalty this season, which takes them second bottom of Scottish League One.

item.title: Horneland 'intensity' perfect for Aberdeen - Stavrum
item.description: Former Aberdeen striker Arild Stavrum believes Dons' managerial candidate – and fellow Norwegian – Eirik Horneland "would be an interesting and a good appointment" for the club.

item.title: Moller sold to Sandefjord after six months at Dundee Utd
item.description: Dundee United sell striker Nikolaj Moller to Norwegian club Sandefjord less than six months after his arrival for free from Swiss outfit St Gallen.

item.title: Ex-Villa striker Duran signs for sixth club aged 22
item.description: Former Aston Villa striker Jhon Duran joins the sixth club of his career at the age of just 22 as he signs for Zenit St Petersburg on loan.

item.title: Why are Real Madrid players training in masks?
item.description: Real Madrid players have been pictured taking part in high-intensity drills while wearing unusual blue masks - so what's the reason for them?

item.title: Booed by some, loved by others - why does Vinicius divide Real fans?
item.description: Despite scoring a vital goal against Rayo Vallecano, why does forward Vinicius Jr continue to split opinion at the Bernabeu?

item.title: Quiz: Name the record transfer for every letter of the alphabet
item.description: When it comes to transfer windows, it's not all about the numbers - the letters are important too!

item.title: Lookman joins Atletico - and will set new record
item.description: Atletico Madrid sign Nigeria forward Ademola Lookman, 28, from Atalanta for £30.3m.

item.title: How Aluko sparked women's football punditry debate
item.description: How former England foward Eni Aluko sparked a women's football punditry debate.

item.title: Can you name every Women's Champions League winner?
item.description: How well do you know the history of the Women's Champions League? Take our quiz to find out.

item.title: Real Madrid's Weir made Scotland captain full-time
item.description: Caroline Weir is named Scotland captain on an official basis before the upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Luxembourg.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
